intro: Crossosoma californicum, commonly known as the California crossosoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and chaparral. Crossosoma californicum is often found in California and parts of Oregon, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
